intro: Lansbergia monticola, commonly known as the mountain lansbergia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Lansbergia monticola thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
